cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 355 miles SSW of New Orleans, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating north-to-north-northeast toward the southeast Louisiana coast, then crossing Mississippi and Alabama tonight and moving into the eastern U.S. on Thursday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana (near Port Fourchon – New Orleans area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: West of Morgan City to Intracoastal City Louisiana (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Morgan City Louisiana to the Mississippi/Alabama border, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeastern Louisiana eastward across Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm force winds (39-73 mph) will begin by midday with hurricane-force gusts possible this afternoon and evening as the center passes very near the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 3–5 ft possible along the lower Mississippi River, Lake Pontchartrain, and adjacent waterways near the port, especially if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with isolated amounts up to 6 inches could cause flash and urban flooding around the port complex.
weather_observation.other_hazards: A few brief tornadoes possible this afternoon and evening; very rough seas and rapid river level fluctuations may disrupt vessel traffic.
